Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Data Architect
Data Management section has implemented Informatica Master Data Management suite and is looking for the T&M for the role of data architect whose responsibilities are not limited to below
Data Strategy: Data Architects are responsible for developing, enhancing implementing and refreshing the organization's data strategy, including defining the data architecture, standards, and policies that govern the use and management of data.
Data Modelling: Data Architects must design and maintain the organization's data models, including conceptual, logical, and physical models that define the structure, relationships, and attributes of the data.
Data Integration: Data Architects must ensure that the organization's data is integrated and harmonized across different systems and platforms, including designing and implementing data integration solutions that enable data to flow seamlessly between different applications and systems.
Data Governance: Data Architects are responsible for developing and implementing data governance policies and procedures, including data quality, data security, and data privacy controls.
Data Security: Data Architects must ensure the security and confidentiality of the organization's data, including designing and implementing security controls, such as access controls, encryption, and data masking.
Data Storage and Management: Data Architects must design and implement the organization's data storage and management infrastructure, including selecting appropriate storage technologies, such as databases and data warehouses, and managing the organization's data assets.
Data Governance Council
Establish Data Governance Policies and Procedures: The Data Architect is responsible for developing and implementing the organization's data governance policies and procedures. This includes defining data quality standards, data security and privacy policies, and data classification and retention policies.
Manage the Data Governance Council: The Data Architect is responsible for leading the Data Governance Council, which is typically comprised of representatives from different departments and business units across the organization. The Council Manager must ensure that the Council is focused on achieving its goals, meeting its objectives, and delivering value to the organization.
Ensure Compliance with Regulations: The Data Architect must ensure that the organization is in compliance with all relevant regulations and legislation related to data privacy and security. This may include Digital Dubai, DESC, and other regulations.
Develop Data Governance Metrics: The Data Architect is responsible for developing and tracking data governance metrics that measure the effectiveness of the organization's data governance program. These metrics may include data quality scores, data usage and access reports, and data security incident reports. Creating Plans and discussing with Data Management team for improving the data quality.
Coordinate Data Governance Activities: The Data Architect must work closely with other departments and business units to coordinate data governance activities and ensure that data governance policies and procedures are being followed consistently across the organization.
Provide Data Governance Training: The Data Architect must develop and deliver data governance training programs for employees across the organization. This may include training on data classification, data security, data privacy, and data quality.
Drive Continuous Improvement: The Data Architect is responsible for driving continuous improvement in the organization's data governance program. This includes identifying areas for improvement, developing and implementing improvement plans, and tracking progress against established goals and objectives.
Collaboration: Data Architects must work closely with other team members, such as Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Analysts, to ensure that the organization's data architecture meets business requirements and supports data-driven decision making.Desired Candidate Profile

Data modelling:
Data Architects must be proficient in developing and managing data models, including conceptual, logical, and physical models. They should have experience in data modelling tools such as ER/Studio, ERWin, or PowerDesigner.
Database management: Data Architects must have strong skills in database design and management, including experience with SQL and database management systems such as Oracle, SQL Server, and Cloudera.
Data integration: Data Architects should have experience in designing and implementing data integration solutions, including ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) processes, data mapping, and data transformation.
Data governance: Data Architects must have a strong understanding of data governance principles and practices, including data quality, data security, and data privacy.
Big data technologies: Data Architects should have experience in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Cloud technologies: Data Architects should have experience in cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform, including cloud data storage and computing.
Business acumen: Data Architects must have a strong understanding of business needs and requirements, as well as the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Communication and collaboration: Data Architects must have strong communication and collaboration skills, as they will need to work closely with business stakeholders, data analysts, data scientists, and other IT professionals.
